ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: A one-function package containing 'prediction()', a type-safe alternative to 'predict()' that always returns a data frame. The 'summary()' method provides a data frame with average predictions, possibly over counterfactual versions of the data (a la the 'margins' command in 'Stata'). Marginal effect estimation is provided by the related package, 'margins' <https://cran.r-project.org/package=margins>. The package currently supports common model types (e.g., "lm", "glm") from the 'stats' package, as well as numerous other model classes from other add-on packages. See the README or main package documentation page for a complete listing.

A one-function package containing 'prediction()', a type-safe alternative to 'predict()' that always returns a data frame. The 'summary()' method provides a data frame with average predictions, possibly over counterfactual versions of the data (a la the 'margins' command in 'Stata'). Marginal effect estimation is provided by the related package, 'margins' <https://cran.r-project.org/package=margins>. The package currently supports common model types (e.g., "lm", "glm") from the 'stats' package, as well as numerous other model classes from other add-on packages. See the README or main package documentation page for a complete listing.

name: r-prediction
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.3.18" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-prediction
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/prediction_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/prediction/prediction_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: d0e6377fd44c3a77618e2d84d6e577bc7753c8171c6f4bf56993eaebd71797a4

build:
  number: 2
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-data.table
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-data.table

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('prediction')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('prediction')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/leeper/prediction
  license: MIT
  summary: A one-function package containing 'prediction()', a type-safe alternative to 'predict()' that always returns a data frame. The 'summary()' method provides a data frame with average predictions, possibly over counterfactual versions of the data (a la the 'margins' command in 'Stata'). Marginal effect estimation
    is provided by the related package, 'margins' <https://cran.r-project.org/package=margins>. The package currently supports common model types (e.g., "lm", "glm") from the 'stats' package, as well as numerous other model classes from other add-on packages. See the README or main package documentation page for a complete
    listing.
  license_family: MIT

  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE
extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - ccwang002

# Package: prediction
# Type: Package
# Title: Tidy, Type-Safe 'prediction()' Methods
# Description: A one-function package containing 'prediction()', a type-safe alternative to 'predict()' that always returns a data frame. The 'summary()' method provides a data frame with average predictions, possibly over counterfactual versions of the data (a la the 'margins' command in 'Stata'). Marginal effect estimation is provided by the related package, 'margins' <https://cran.r-project.org/package=margins>. The package currently supports common model types (e.g., "lm", "glm") from the 'stats' package, as well as numerous other model classes from other add-on packages. See the README or main package documentation page for a complete listing.
